intro: Matelea cyclophylla, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, known for its showy, nocturnal blooms. The plant produces large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close during the day. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. Matelea cyclophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
